body: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

body: It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.
author: Epictetus

body: The best answer to anger is silence.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
author: Seneca

body: They lose the day in expectation of the night, and the night in fear of the dawn.
author: Seneca

body: Better to trip with the feet than with the tongue.
author: Zeno

body: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: Epictetus

body: How ridiculous and how strange to be surprised at anything which happens in life.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: Reject your sense of injury and the injury itself disappears.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
author: Seneca

body: Wealth is the slave of the wise. The master of the fool.
author: Seneca

body: He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.
author: Seneca

body: It is not that we have so little time but that we lose so much. ... The life we receive is not short but we make it so; we are not ill provided but use what we have wastefully.
author: Seneca

body: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.
author: Seneca

body: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
author: Seneca

body: You act like mortals in all that you fear, and like immortals in all that you desire.
author: Seneca

body: Receive without conceit, release without struggle.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: Be content to seem what you really are.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.
author: Zeno

body: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: Whoever does not regard what he has as most ample wealth, is unhappy, though he be master of the world.
author: Epictetus

body: The worst ruler is one who cannot rule himself.
author: Cato

body: We have two ears and one mouth, so we should listen more than we say.
author: Zeno

body: The goal of life is living in agreement with Nature.
author: Zeno

body: Well-being is attained little by little, and nevertheless is no little thing itself.
author: Zeno

body: The more we value things outside our control, the less control we have.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: It is not events that disturb people, it is their judgements concerning them.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: To love only what happens, what was destined. No greater harmony.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future, not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears but to rest satisfied with what we have, which is sufficient, for he that is so, wants nothing.
author: Seneca

body: Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
author: Seneca

body: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
author: Seneca

body: Associate with people who are likely to improve you.
author: Seneca

body: Man is affected not by events but by the view he takes of them.
author: Seneca

body: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
author: Seneca

body: You want to live but do you know how to live? You are scared of dying and tell me, is the kind of life you lead really any different from being dead?
author: Seneca

body: Time heals what reason cannot.
author: Seneca

body: The greatest blessings of mankind are within us and within our reach. A wise man is content with his lot, whatever it may be, without wishing for what he has not.
author: Seneca

body: Hang on to your youthful enthusiasms - you'll be able to use them better when you're older.
author: Seneca

body: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
author: Seneca

body: The bravest sight in the world is to see a great man struggling against adversity.
author: Seneca

body: Until we have begun to go without them, we fail to realize how unnecessary many things are. We've been using them not because we needed them but because we had them.
author: Seneca

body: Life is never incomplete if it is an honorable one. At whatever point you leave life, if you leave it in the right way, it is whole.
author: Seneca

body: He who follows reason in all things is both tranquil and active at the same time, and also cheerful and collected.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: You're subject to sorrow, fear, jealousy, anger and inconsistency. That's the real reason you should admit that you are not wise.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: Receive without pride, let go without attachment.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: I have often wondered how it is that every man loves himself more than all the rest of men, but yet sets less value on his own opinions of himself than on the opinions of others.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: Today I escaped anxiety. Or no, I discarded it, because it was within me, in my own perceptions - not outside.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: If it's not right, don't do it. If it's not true, don't say it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

body: We have two ears and one mouth, therefore we should listen twice as much as we speak.
author: Zeno

body: Who is your master? Anyone who has control over things upon which you've set your heart, or over things which you seek to avoid.
author: Epictetus

body: You are not your body and hair-style, but your capacity for choosing well. If your choices are beautiful, so too will you be.
author: Epictetus

body: Circumstances don't make the man, they only reveal him to himself.
author: Epictetus

body: We are not privy to the stories behind people's actions, so we should be patient with others and suspend judgement of them, recognizing the limits of our understanding.
author: Epictetus

body: In prosperity it is very easy to find a friend; but in adversity it is the most difficult of all things.
author: Epictetus

body: Deliberate much before saying or doing anything, for you will not have the power of recalling what is said or done.
author: Epictetus

body: To make the best of what is in our power, and take the rest as it occurs.
author: Epictetus
